subject: RE: [junit] JxUnit: Running the Same Test with Multiple Data File s
msgSnippet: Use www.google.com  http://www.google.com/search?q=JXunit  ... From: Vitezslav Stejskal
messageBody:
Use www.google.com
 
http://www.google.com/search?q=JXunit
-----Original Message-----
From: Vitezslav Stejskal [mailto:vitezslav.stejskal@...]
Sent: 15 May 2001 17:39
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] JxUnit: Running the Same Test with Multiple Data Files

Could you please provide me with pointer to JXunit home page ...

Thanks,
Vita

Thomas P Varghese wrote:

> Dear nataliabello
>    You might have not given the test script but i assume that this might be
> the test script you are using to test multiple test files
>
> <jxu>
>    <set name="data" file="absDataFileName" indirect="true"/>
>    <ifEqual converse="true" name="data" value="dataFileName"
> indirect="true">
>         <save name="data" file="badFileName_.txt"/>
>         <fail>Each test file must contain only its own name!  </fail>
>    </ifEqual>
> </jxu>
>
> and the testing context might be
> <jxuc >
>         <directoryScan dir="as">
>                 <includeFiles regexp=".txt$"/>
>         </directoryScan>
> </jxuc>
>
> as is the name of the directory holding the configuration.
> I feel that if it is like this then there might be no faliure.
>
>   For specifing the test class in the script there is a element <eval>
> where we can specicify the test class.
> Thanks
> Thomas
>
> >From: nataliabello@...
> >Reply-To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> >To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: [junit] JxUnit: Running the Same Test with Multiple Data Files
> >Date: Tue, 15 May 2001 08:06:41 -0000
> >
> >Hi!
> >I know that this is the Junit group, but maybe someone has used the
> >JXunit extension; so here is my problem:
> >I am trying to run an example with multiple data using the files
> >test.jxu  and test.jxuc that are in the JXunit page but i dont
> >success, i have always:
> >.F.F
> >Time: 0.28
> >There were 2 failures:
> >1) d:\java\as\myData.txt(net.sourceforge.jxunit.JXTestCase) "Each
> >test file must contain only its own name!"
> >2) d:\java\as\myData2.txt(net.sourceforge.jxunit.JXTestCase) "Each
> >test file must contain only its own name!"
> >
> >FAILURES!!!
> >Tests run: 2,  Failures: 2,  Errors: 0
> >
> >In the txt files,I have the same name of the files.
> >Does anyone know what i am doing wrong?
> >Another question, where I say what class i want to test, because is
> >not mention in the test.jxu neither in test.jxuc??
> >Thanks in advance,
> >N
> >
>
